One of the world’s top photographers, Patrick Demarchelier, 74, has been accused by six women of ‘sex attacks’.

The snapper, who was known as Princess Diana’s personal photographer, has been named among ‘at least 25 photographers, agents, stylists, casting directors, and other industry professionals’ for assaulting or harassing models in a damning article.

In a report by The Boston Globe, more than 50 models came forward to make ‘credible’ allegations against leading people in the fashion industry, including Demarchelier, one of which stemmed from a previous assistant who worked with the respected photographer.

Actress Emma Watson has donated £1million to an anti-sexual harassment campaign, which seeks to support women who have fallen victim to sexual harassment in their workplaces.

The Harry Potter star donated the mighty sum to the UK Justice and Equality Fund, after nearly 200 British and Irish female stars signed an open letter published in the Observer, calling for an end to sexual harassment.

It was signed by stars such as ​Emma Thompson, Carey Mulligan, Saoirse Ronan, Gemma Chan, Kiera Knightley and Watson herself.

Kendall Jenner may have missed out on walking New York Fashion because of her anxiety.

The 22-year-old has always been such a go-getter when it comes to her modelling – having walked in over 89 runways in her relatively short (thus far) fashion career.

So we couldn’t help but notice that mighty Kendall was absent this New York Fashion Week – though she was in the city and did attend an Off-White x Jimmy Choo dinner and Adidas Originals presentation.

Interesting…

Alexandra Burke says she can feel her mum’s presence coming through her when she sings.

The 29-year-old lost her mother Melissa Bell last year after she passed away following a nine-year battle with kidney failure.

Alexandra was left heartbroken by the news and was on the brink of packing in her career, but knew that her mother would have wanted her to carry on performing.
